could actually combine the two so live migration uh the idea of live
migration is to move a process from a source host to a destination host
and the idea is that the process will continue to run in the source host
while you set up the destination host in order to reduce the amount of uh
downtime and latency so the things to consider when setting up the destination host is the network
connectivity uh the remote disk availability uh migrating the data from the local host
on the destination on the source and moving that data to the destination
uh copying memory states in phases that includes moving all of the memory that the
process is using from the source to the destination then
while the process is still running on the source to remove the deltas the current differences
of the memory until you calculate the minimum pause time that the process can be brought down to copy over the
differences then you copy over the cpu state and again the goal is to limit the pausing
of the process and then you can restart the process on the destination
host once you've stopped the process on the source host and then you can clean up all the data
on the source host so we can illustrate that through these
transitions currently the process is running on the source
we set up a synchronize the disk and we start the memory transfer we estimate the minimum downtime while
we continue the memory transfer and the deltas that are accumulating
once we reach the minimum downtime we pause the process on the
source we activate the network we complete the memory transfers
we then run the process on the destination and then we do the cleanup on the source
so for live migration from host one to host 2 transitioning
considering the local disk data on host 1 you can see that the guest
process already migrated to host 2. it requests the data from the controller
on host 2 which communicates with the controller on host 1.
it accesses the storage that still hasn't migrated yet so that the process can use it currently
and at the same time data is continually being transferred
from host one to host two via the controllers until all the data is copied to host two
in which case you no longer need the connection

expected results you calculate the percentage of error you'll then
modify the algorithm and you'll do the process over again until the
percentage of error is at a lowest threshold and that's acceptable
and that's called machine learning
